result.execSummary:
The defendant Poppy M Crowe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $343  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  Court authorized payment plan.
Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JW w/o prior written approval of agent. Not to be at or around any taverns or bars.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant's copy of Civil Judgment for Unpaid Court Obligations returned.  No forwarding address. Filed in 14CF1228.
ADA moves to orally amend ct 3. Crt accepts oral amendment. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Upon recommendation that the defendant be terminated from the Bail Monitoring Program, court ordered Arrest Warrant be issued and once in custody, defendant's cash bail be reinstated in the amt of $1,000 per case. All other previous bail conditions remain set.  Arrest warrant issued.  Original and copy of warrant to DCSO.  Copy for file.
Final pre-trial on September 17, 2014 at 08:15 am.
and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Plea of not guilty entered by counsel. Motions due in 20 days. Bail continued.
Waiver of Right to Prelim Hrg filed.
Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Janna W.
- Defendant shall not be in the 3400th block of Harper Rd in Madison, WI.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1000.00 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 15

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney State Public Defender.  Diane Schlipper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
